comment: Dr. Abbott treated this class like it was a PHD class. Some people in here just want to take the class and get it over with, and she heavily enforced learning the concepts. No curve, no extra credit, and the exams are hard. She makes you feel stupid for not being some kind of chemistry genius. The class is hard, and she made it way harder.
rating_tags: Lots of homework

comment: She is amazing and knowledgable in her own right. She is well respected and very welcoming of questions and is super relatable despite her credentials. The lectures were understandable. As long as you pay attention to details you'll do great.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Inspirational--Accessible outside class

comment: She was a really good professor. I liked her teaching style very quick and efficient and always helped when needed. Class itself was pretty easy so it was not too bad.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria
Caring--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: She's a very nice teacher but her teaching style is just too fast for my liking. I was on the verge of passing the class and emailed her to see if she could help but she never answered. If you aren't good at chem don't take it pleaaase for your own sanity
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Abbott is an exceptional teacher in the chemistry field with her fast-paced lectures, detailed PowerPoints, and knowledgeable skills. Do not go into this class thinking it will be easy, Dr. Abbott is the head of the chemistry department when it comes to 1211. One quiz every week, 1-2 homework assignments a week, and 4 tests + a final exam.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Abbott-Lyon truly cares about chemistry and her students succeed in chemistry. Her lectures are crucial to attend and although she doesn't take attendance, your test grades will reflect on how dedicated you are to succeeding. If you put in the work and attempt all of the things she recommends, then this class will be an easy A or B.
rating_tags: Caring--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: She is a great teacher but you need to be ready to be a great student. SHe offers a lot of help and has great lectures. You need to take it upon yourself to work at the content on your own time.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: the knowledgeable professor who knows her stuff but goes through the material quite quickly. many people struggle in this class and the only extra help you get is the corresponding sections on the final can replace test grades which ended up helping me in the long run. This course is difficult with weekly homework and quizzes 4 tests and a final
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Abbott is an AMAZING professor, but her class is pretty challenging. She is clearly very passionate about what she does and is willing to answer any and every question you have. Attend her office hours or SI sessions if you can; that helps a LOT! No extra credit but she drops the 3 lowest grades per unit. If you want to LEARN chem take her!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Accessible outside class

comment: Chem is tricky no matter what teacher you take, but Prof. Abbott did not help to make it any easier for me. In a class of 60+ people, the average for each test was always a failing grade. Prof Abbott was super sweet but she just seemed a little too smart to be teaching an entry-level chem class. Prepare to struggle if you arent already good at chem
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Very enthusiastic about chemistry and about class. She wants her students to do well, but you must also put in the effort to learn the material since the topics covered are pretty complex. The only grades for the class were the 3 midterm tests and the final, so it's essential to clear up any confusion with the material quickly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Accessible outside class

comment: In-class open note quizzes every Friday, homework and worksheets/textbook notes due every week. 4 exams and 1 cumulative final. The final replaces the lowest test grades! Even though we had to take notes out of the textbook, the textbook was useless for the exams. Come to class or you will fail! Math heavy and some conceptual.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Very great teacher with an amazing personality. Lectures are in depth with little time to take notes but she does provide practice in class. Highly recommend going to office hours and completing homework. Lots of content to cover with only little time in class so try to go to every class. 4 exam multiple choice with a SCR and a 60 question final.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: She has a great attitude about class and treats each lecture as a more in-depth look into what we were reading. Paying the 75$ for a textbook does make it annoying, but she sets us up by making us read the chapter content before the lecture and then allows us to ask for more clarification in the actual lecture. Really solid teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Avoid unless you are prepared to pay $75+ for the textbook (and homework that you won't even use), print out 5-10 pages of worksheets each week, and are a verryyy fast learner. The in-class pace is way too fast. There is way too much discussed in one period and you'll just end up working on everything yourself anyway. Should've dropped when I could
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: the worst professor ive ever had. take anyone but her, she talks like shes knowledgeable but in reality no one should have allowed her to become a professor. shes nice tho i guess, fake tinker bell energy.

She assigns lots of hw, reading, and quizzes so be prepared for that, however all of the assignments were made to help students pass the course and get them to study the material regularly. Definitely to go to office hours and take her study advice, my exam score rose 20 points when I did that. Her lectures are good and she's super nice.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Abbott is super nice and definitely does what she can to help students do well. Although the class is tough she does a lot of grade adjustment at the end of the semester which brought my grade from a D to a B. She assigns a lot of out of class work but if you do it then you should get a 100% as she grades for completion on most of it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: No curve on anything. All exams are 50% multiple choice and 50% free response, which she grades super harshly. She does not give study guides or conceptual problems to practice (guess what's mostly on the test?!). The textbook is useless and so are the LA's. Changed the format of the final at the last minute, probably costing me an A. AVOID!!!!

PChem (i.e., quantum mechanics) is definitely a rigorous class. You have to work your butt off to even pass the exams. A "good" class average is 56%. That wouldn't be an issue if there was an appropriate curve applied to exam scores. But, with Dr. AL, that's not the case. Not even on the final, which is half ACS MC & half free response! Beware!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Abbott is a very fun and energetic professor. She cares a lot about her students and their success in the class. This class is very difficult, and so is her style of teaching. The homework is ridiculously hard, and so are the in class quizzes. I went to class, studied, sought help from outside the classroom, and still didn't pass this class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Professor Abott has a good heart and she really wants her students to actually learn the material. However, if you want to pass Chem do not take her. Her teaching is really hard to follow and her quizzes and tests are impossible. Even if you put in the work and study theres still a chance your probably going to fail.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Her tests were hard. They're supposed to be. It's a chemistry class. The final was awful. The reading quizzes weren't that bad. You had a few chances to take each and the edpuzzle videos would go over the questions. She's extremely helpful and you can always talk to her inside or outside of class. Just go to class and do your work. You'll be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: The tests were unbelievably hard. The practice tests did not help. We would take 3 quizzes a week before class. You have to read the book to get the answers. Class the next day would go over the material we were quizzed on. This makes no sense to me, I rather be taught then take a quiz. I barely got a B. Be sure to do the homework.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: "Majority of you will have a difficult time finishing this test" and "When you get to 1212 you will need to know this" Knowing the concepts and equations is not enough, but she tests you on the infinite # of exceptions and special cases. Four tests and a final, class avg on tests were all failing by far. Dont, just dont.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: You can tell she knows and enjoys chemistry. Its a flipped classroom and thats difficult in hard subject like chem. If you watch the videos and take notes on them that she provides outside of class you will do good. Pay attention and interact in class. She does want everyone to do well. 4 tests that can be replaced by the final and weekly quiz
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: The test are hard with little to no information given in class. There are a lot of quizzes , homework is hard and she barely helps during office hours. Worksheets are given in class as busy work.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: If you've never been bright but you got through high school by doing the homework, participating in class, etc, this is the hand-holding prof for you. Passing this class is about so much more than simply knowing the curriculum. If you just wanna learn, test, and move on, leave now. If you need a lego set to understand stoichiometry, stay.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Dr. Abbot-Lyon legitimately cares about most of her students and their success. Unfortunately, she has very strange ideas for what makes students successful. Tests aren't curved unless the average is around a 50. She struggles with organization and clarity, contradicting herself often. This class will be the hardest thing you ever do.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Abbott is just as passionate about helping you pass as she is about chemistry. Its gonna be hard no matter what so if you can take it with her! Don't be afraid to ask questions -- she makes herself very available and can explain concepts in multiple ways to help understand. She is awesome!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Dr. Abbott is a very nice woman. She cares about all of her students; if you put in the effort that is. Her class is challenging but not impossible. She teaches at a very fast past so its very important that you do the homework she assigns online before you go to class. This will allow you to actually kind of know what shes talking about.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Dr. Abbott was an exceptional professor. Her lectures are very clear cut and even though my class was in a large lecture environment, she made sure every student got individual attention. Chem isn't easy, and reading other comments I believe that people have forgotten that they are now adult in  a higher learning environment. Real students only.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: Chemistry is a hard subject no matter who you take it with. So when evaluating just the teacher presenting the material, Abbott was very passionate and knowledgable about this course. And you could tell she cared about her students. Very generous, helpful, and professional. Makes you work for your grade. (Do not skip class if you want to do well!)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: P Chem is difficult enough without her. Quiz M/F and homework every W so I can never get caught up on my reading. Practice exams are way easier than the real exams. She doesn't answer half the questions she poses on her powerpoints.  Overall a lot of busy work and no real tools for success for this hard class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: ***PLEASE LISTEN TO ME*** She is the worst professor at KSU. You are expected to learn everything at home through "pre-lecture" videos and she goes over the material for 5 minutes in class while she babysits you thru worksheets (no credit) for the rest of the class. So much hw, have to attend class for the online quizzes every day  DO NOT TAKE!!!

DO NOT TAKE HER. Tests are completely different from study guides so you have no idea what to expect. 15 questions and a short response so miss more than 2 and you fail. Flipped classroom so she does not teach material. Textbook is essential if you want to even make a C. Would not recommend.

Dr Abbott is more concerned with her research than her students. She treats her students as if they are SO beneath her, and constantly insults your intelligence. Perhaps she should consider that she is a horrible teacher, and that most of the students really ARE trying as hard as they can.

Dr Abbott is NOT a good professor . She messed up on one of the tests and she would not admit that she was wrong. Brags a lot about her intellectual ability but she DOESN'T even know what she teaches. Most of the time she tells us to ignore what she had previously taught because it was wrong. she should stick to teaching Gen Chem. DO NOT TAKE HER!!

Dr A is THE BEST professor at KSU. She is organized, tells you what will be on the test at the beginning of each ppt, and pads your grade with quizzes and homework. If the class avg is low on a test she will give redemption points with a quiz or replace the grade with your final. She makes  a difficult subject easy to understand so dont skip class.

I know she is extremely passionate, and that is great, but she often messed up in class on example problems and in writing tests often. This wouldn't have been so bad if she had extended any grace to students who didn't get something on the first try.  If you have to take her and don't understand it, do not expect any kindness during office hours.
Spent so much time on this course.  A tutor won't even help because she goes so far off what was taught in previous semesters.
I've never met a more terrifying woman.  Expect to work as hard as you can but still be treated like you are stupid pond scum.

I can sort of see why a lot of people would be frustrated with her but to be honest, physical chemistry is going to be hard no matter who teaches it. She's not the greatest test writer, or lecturer, but I think she really does care. A lot of the reviews here are a little extreme. No she isn't the greatest but she's not the worst.

Physical chemistry is a tough subject. She doesn't teach it well at all. Often got confused on her own problems in class, and course materials were fairly disorganized and often late in being available to students.
Comparing my notes/tests to other pchem 3050 classes, mine was 50X harder and a lot less clear/to the point.  I know she is passionate about the subject but just wait until someone else is teaching.

Heather Abbott is a very intelligent individual who still somehow lacks the capacity to teach, or keep herself under control. She would be better suited to lab work or being alone on an island where she would not burden aspiring students with her issues. I would highly recommend avoiding her if you would like to learn or be taught.

She is unorganized, tests are often out of left field, and she seems to not understand some of the concepts herself. She's also really spastic and doesn't keep promises about when she will have your grade posted.

Dr. Abbott is a really great teacher, she explains chemistry well and really helps with practice problems if you have the chance take her. A lot, I mean a lot of KSU's science teachers suck, they are really horrible, but Dr. Abbott is really a good one. Plus her SI is really good to.

Dr. Abbott has been the best professor I have had so far in my college experience. All of her classes are lectures based on powerpoints that really involves the class a lot with practice problems that she goes over with the entire class. She wants to make sure everyone is on the same page. Test aren't bad if you study and there are SI sessions!!!!

Dr. Abbott explained the concepts very well and made the class easy to understand. A recent background of high school chemistry is very essential to having an easy time in this class, but the tests are very clear.

She's super nice and means well. I had only ever taking a chemistry class once and it was 5 years ago and I managed a B with alot of hard work and dedication. I recommend attending class. You have a pre-lecture quiz every Monday and its timed. The class is hard if you don't know Chemistry. Class is very fast paced because there's alot of material.
Dr. Abbott was great. She took her time to explain to everybody whatever she was teaching. Very strict about dress codes too.
Very good lab  instructor. Lots of powerpoints. helpful when you have questions, but have to pay attention.

Lectures off powerpoints; mostly easy to understand. Messes up on math calculations (b/c she doesnt use a calculator) but fixes it. 4 tests, Final is the ACS final (not made by Abbott). Class participation points, online HW and pre-lecture quizzes. Very friendly and fair. Tests:15-20 multiple choice and 2-3 free response

She is so helpful! She went out of her way to help the class study for the final as it was the day after we took a test! I am taking her class again as she is an amazing teacher and will help you whether you go to her office hours or email her and ask her questions. She is an amazing teacher! Take her!

Hands down the best teacher I had this semester.  The class/subject material is hard.  She moves quickly because she only has 1:15min.  Doing the HW and reading the book is not enough. You must understand the material, once you do, class is a breeze. Tests are easy with the above studying. Suck it up and spend 3-4hrs per weekend doing the homework.

She is a good teacher but she gets stressed out easily and is very hyper. She's great if you visit her office hours! She makes a lot of mistakes while working out example problems which is a bit frustrating. Her practice tests are much easier than the real tests.

Extremely helpful if you have any questions. Labs aren't easy but she makes it a lot easier! She's a little strict on grading but it helps you learn what to do. As far as office hours she's extremely flexible. One of the nicest professors I've met.

She has here heart in the right place and wants you to do well but she is unorganized. Its like she doesn't look over her power points before a class. It makes it confusing to follow her..review the material prior to class. The book is extremely helpful and as far as test... Just study suggested problems and hw...makes huge difference!

she is very helpful. I went to her office hour all the time but she always seems to be happy to help. Her test is not hard, but can be tricky. I think she is the most hardworking professor I have ever had! She tries hard to help you prepare for the ACS final. This class takes so much work, need to read the textbook ahead of lecture . learned a lot.

Make sure you read the chapters before class. It is one of the better textbooks, and she teaches straight from the book. Sometimes she gets mixed up when teaching. If you read the book and do the online quizzes and practice tests, then you should make a good grade. Make sure you get the ACS study guide for the final. Read the book!!! Fairly easy A.

Make sure you have a good background in chemistry before taking her class! She is very knowlegable but will not take any time to review! Also, revie notes AHEAD of time (posted online). The hardest part is keeping up and all of her homework quizzes. The tests aren't that bad.

She knows the material very well. However, she can get confusing. Her tests are really not that hard just study and do the practice tests. Shes really a good teacher and wants you to succeed. I think she deserves more credit then what her rating actually is.

Dr. Abbott is a great teacher. The bad comments here are from lazy students that DGAF. Chemistry is a difficult subject, so a student needs to put more effort in than just going to class. Her tests are extremely fair. She prepares you with a practice test and tells you the concepts you must know. Always do the suggested problems to help you study!

Knowledgable but no idea how to teach. Her examples are almost always incorrect, her lectures are never helpful in explaining the concepts, and her tests are incredibly hard. She obviously cares about her students and is helpful, however she has no comprehension of how to teach the material. One of the worst professors I've ever had.

taking her class is not as dramatic as all the other comments make it seem. however, she can get pretty confusing while lecturing, so if you cant follow quickly and realize her errors almost immediately, youll probably get lost. she is smart and really cares about chem. you just have to be prepared.

VERY knowledgeable, but if you have no background in chemistry then good luck. She knows what she is talking about, but she has problems with trying to teach it. I barely worked in the book:she gives you notes and practice tests. Sometimes she would make errors, so you would have to watch out for emails correcting them. Overall I enjoyed the class.

She is very knowledgeable however her teaching methods are absolutely terrible, if you actually want to do well in chemistry and learn the material i would recommend a different professor. Also when teaching the material she gets concepts confused so you are taught wrong.
If you want to learn chemisty and do well, stay away from her classes. She is a smart woman and she knows the material very well however she cannot teach.
